*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to James F. Perry, November 17, 1831. Advice about home.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**date_mentioned n="11-17-1831">Novr. 17. 1831*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dr *person_mentioned*Brother*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*I am happy to inform you that I left my room *date_mentioned n="11-16-1831">yesterday */date_mentioned*and rode down to see *person_mentioned*sister*/person_mentioned*, also that *date_mentioned n="11-16-1831">last night*/date_mentioned* She was safely delivered of a fine *person_mentioned*Son */person_mentioned*I give you joy—all is doing well—what a host of boys you will have—*/p*
*p*If I recruit as fast as I have the last four days I shall be able to start to *location_mentioned*Anahuac */location_mentioned*in a *date_mentioned n="11-24-1831">week*/date_mentioned*, If I can hire a boat there, I will go by water direct to your place on*location_mentioned* chocolate bayou*/location_mentioned*, and thence up home by *location_mentioned*Brazoria */location_mentioned*and *location_mentioned*Bolivar */location_mentioned*but you must furnish me horses.*/p*
*p*I forgot to mention that *location_mentioned*north side of pleasant Creek*/location_mentioned* will be the best for the field on one important particular, the wind is so severe from the *location_mentioned*sea */location_mentioned*that I am told it whips out the corn and blows it down, the timber of *location_mentioned*pleasant Creek*/location_mentioned* would keep off the wind from a field on the north side, The south side is the place to live*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S. F. Austin */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*p*[Addressed:]*person_mentioned* Mr. James. F. Perry*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*Chocolate Bayou*/location_mentioned*—Care of *person_mentioned*Cap. John Austin */person_mentioned*who will please forward it by first safe opportunity*/p*
*/div1*
